parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It promotes a compatibility test to help voters understand their political values and make an informed choice. While this indirectly relates to the election, it doesn't endorse or discourage voting for any particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and aims to reach a wide audience through its compatibility test. The website address further suggests a broad reach.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is not to influence the vote for a specific candidate. Instead, it aims to encourage informed voting by providing a tool for self-assessment of political values.  The post promotes civic engagement and participation, not support for a particular party or candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of civic journalism or public service announcement. It aims to educate and inform voters, providing them with resources to make informed decisions. The involvement of reputable organizations like Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung further supports this interpretation.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; rather, it presents a tool for voters to assess their own political alignment.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1098683801963032</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while related to the electoral process, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post promotes a political compatibility test designed to help voters make informed choices. It does not endorse or discourage voting for any specific candidate or party. The involvement of reputable organizations like Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung further suggests a non-partisan, educational intent. The post encourages participation but does not advocate for a particular outcome.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by the law.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
